title: Reverse Array after Position
problem:
Given an array/list 'ARR' of integers and a position ‘M’. You have to reverse the array after that position.

Example:

We have an array ARR = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6} and M = 3 , considering 0 
based indexing so the subarray {5, 6} will be reversed and our 
output array will be {1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 5}.

Detailed explanation ( Input/output format, Notes, Images )

Constraints:
1 <= T <= 10
0 <= M <= N <= 5*10^4
-10^9 <= ARR[i] <= 10^9

Time Limit: 1 sec

Sample Input 1:

2
6 3
1 2 3 4 5 6
5 2
10 9 8 7 6

Sample Output 1:

1 2 3 4 6 5
10 9 8 6 7

Explanation 1:

For the first test case, 
Considering 0-based indexing we have M = 3 so the 
subarray[M+1 … N-1] has to be reversed.
Therefore the required output will be {1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 5}.

For the second test case, 
Considering 0-based indexing we have M = 2 so the 
subarray[M+1 … N-1] has to be reversed.
Therefore the required output will be {10, 9, 8, 6, 7}.

Sample Input 2:

2
7 3
1 4 5 6 6 7 7 
9 3
10 4 5 2 3 6 1 3 6

Sample Output 2:

1 4 5 6 7 7 6
10 4 5 2 6 3 1 6 3
